CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mable Rollins, 1828 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" answer reads: "Why, yes, I should say that because colored persons should have a better place to live." "(Editor's Note: Rackets are not confined to "colored" neighborhoods.)"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mable Rollins, wearing eyeglasses, dark belted coat with fur collar, and light colored floral brooch, standing in front of parking lot
